comments.commentBody: I suppose the self centered, misogynistic, ego maniac is a better choice??

Hmm AACNY, you seem to be faulting the media's outrage ("in unison") over him not saying he'll accept the election results. I am shocked by your casual dismissal of the seriousness of this. If Trump was a sore loser about the Republican primaries he lost and the Apprentice loss and Ted Cruz's wife and and and - it makes more sense that he is still that same sore loser now, doesn't it?
I other words, there are two possibilities. 1) There's a giant anti-Trump conspiracy that somehow includes anti-Trump Republicans like Mitt Romney, Paul Ryan, John McCain, who must be in on the supposed rigging, or 2) Trump is just the sore-loser loose cannon he has always been. Which is more likely, Einstein?

What would a Trump event be if the media didn't, in unison, find something to be shocked and outraged over? Tonight it's his refusal to accept (cede?) an election loss.

Only a fool believes this will have any significance a week from now. By then the media pack will be on to the next big threat to our republic. All in unison they will be talking about the next big thing he said.
A "Nasty Woman"....And he claims to have respect for women more than anyone else on this planet.

As an American this man is a humiliation - a walking disgrace. The only thing more embarrassing is that so many Americans are ignorant enough, racist enough and sexist enough to support him. Ms. Clinton however, makes me proud to be an American woman!
Here is your Trump: lying, lying, lying with his two eyes widely open. Purely shameless.
You do realize she's a veteran politician of 30years, right? Not Mother Theresa? That as all politicians she has to be shrewd and look at things from all angles before taking a leap?

Dear Eric Koski,
Ah, don't be too sure. As someone who voted for Sanders, I'll be happy to admit, in three weeks Sanders and Trump supporters will both have supported a losing candidate.
As the legendary John McLaughlin said, Bye Bye... Donald!
By the way, what was the result of Donald's drug test?

• Same rhetoric different dressing.
• Would you rather be groped or taxed?
• Do you want to be stopped and frisked, or for all to be told to drop the weight and you will lower your copays.

Chris Wallace was anything but fair:
https://thinkprogress.org/chris-wallaces-fair-and-balanced-questions-7d1...
Not that is matters much but I do believe that Mr. Wallace is the only registered democrat who moderated a debate this year.

Then you haven't been worried enough. You should be angry and willing to fight for your country should the need arise. Trump has been advocating TREASON through much of the campaign. He should have been charged long ago. Incarcerated in solitary, and kicked out of the election.

Something else caught my eye during the debate, why does he almost never open his eyes? He does it at rallies too. Should make it really hard to read a teleprompter. Is he squinting because he can't see? Is he going blind (if so of what? Cataracts are very fixable now, if you can put total control in the surgeon's hands. Oh that's why. He'll probably just go blind or take a knife to his own eyes).
The rally he tore down the teleprompters at, breaking one, he said he'd pay 20% of the cost. Should be forced to pay 120%, just cause he is 'such a nasty' man.

By far the best debate of the three. I can't believe I am stating this about a Fox News person but Chris Wallace did a very good job, and was fair. Hillary Clinton was Presidential, was clear in her answers and showed herself to be far more knowledgeable in every area that was covered than Trump, who simply refused to answer many of the questions asked by Mr. Wallace. I doubt Trump's supporters were swayed, but hopefully some voters who had not made up their minds were convinced that Clinton would make a far better President than Trump, based on her intelligent approach to move this country forward. Trump has no real plans for this country, just a slogan. He is an empty suit.
I do think the fact that Trump's refusal to state unequivocally that he would accept the election results will stand out in most people's minds. Also his use of the word hombre was meant to be offensive and that will resonate with many and not in a good way.
For myself, I am just glad the debates are finally over. This whole election process this year has been exhausting, and draining.

The debate is over Secretary Hillary Clinton wins !!!!

No further discussion required ... Just Vote !!!
Tragically there will be states that don't know how to vote and will stay red. Blood's on their hands if Trump gets assassinated.
But then of course there's nothing she could say that would be agreeable to you, right?

No one of Presidential material would ever consider calling his opponent a 'nasty woman.'  What an immature JERK.  Hillary Clinton spoke policy; Donald Trump spoke gibberish.  Trump's bounce is likely right into the toilet.
Really poor judgement

To be fair, the CNN moderators knew that if they were "disciplinarians" as Wallace has been hailed for being, Trump would've screamed media bias.  Wallace, coming from Fox, was free of that constraint, and probably more concerned that he be seen as seeming fair to Hillary.

Actually even his Syria talk was based entirely on fiction. The things he said are at odds with what is actually happening, and his ridiculous repetitive asking Wallace "have you seen Aleppo?" left many heads scratching. OF COURSE a news anchor has seen what is happening in Aleppo. He is not Gary Johnson for Gods sake. Being a relatively fair moderator, Wallace did not ask the obvious - has trump other than the news he said he watched during the afternoon as "debate prep?"
Maybe he'll take up residence in his DC bldg.  So near, and yet so far.

Although the most important topics were (of course) left off the agenda, it was a decent debate tonight. Wallace was pretty good actually, especially compared to the CNN moderators who offered nothing and let everything spin out of control.

Donald got a taste of what a big league debate is like. None of this nursery school-level GOP stuff. He did a decent job talking about Syria, but otherwise came across as having little more detail than his standard 2015 primary rants. Maybe he's been a little preoccupied lately seeing the value of his brand collapse.

This one was over by Round 3. Hillary simply took him apart, she landed multiple hard blows, sliced him and diced him up and then pivoted right over to Russian influence when the topic had been wikileaks. She was masterful, and he now has his ticket back to Trump tower for the next four years.
Dream on!
Nah, a grade schooler.
Chris Wallace is impressive and is rock solid he gets my vote for President

How can anyone expect Trump to support the outcome before it takes place, Daniel?

I ask you, how can anyone expect to be President of our democratic constitutional republic if he can't grasp its most crucial principle? Unconditional support for the outcome is all that stands between us and a series of bloody coups, or a repeat of the Civil War. The national peace is more important than which candidate wins. It's the tacit premise upon which all democracies are based.

How can anyone expect Trump on any person with critical thinking abilities to declare the election fair and to support its outcome before it takes place? As far as Trump whining about unfairness in the campaign, read this. http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/oct/19/ted-cruz-calls-criminal-...

Trump knows that you have to hold your audience in suspense so they will put up with the advertisements in between the drama. The narrative will change from "Who will win" to "Will Trump conceed?"
Win or lose, Trump gets what he wants. An election night all about him. Find out what happens next time on Trump's television hit: the American Presidential Election 2016.

Trump is simply devoid of any respect, honor, or character. He embodies the worst of humanity. I, for one refuse to give even a modicum of consideration  to his dark, petty world full of doom, gloom and wild conspiracies. He is the worst kind of bully and a truly dangerous individual. And the saddest part of all are all are the Trump supporters who are desperate to be heard - he is simply whipping them into froth of anarchy and threatening our very democracy with his psycho spin.
If Trump wins the presidency, does that mean the whole system has suddenly been unrigged?

I don't believe this will happen.  There will be, perhaps, some minor upheavals.  But in the end, the true Trump supporters will move on and lose interest, just like their candidate.  Trump will not continue to campaign if he loses, because he doesn't really care about his supporters.  As soon as the show is over, he's done.  There has been no widespread movement for Trump supporters to work legitimately within the political system to campaign for him or become poll watchers.  In the end, they will throw tantrums and after the tears dry and their voices are hoarse, go to sleep.
